required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study on Safety and Efficacy of Biphasic Insulin Aspart in Type 2 Diabetes Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi Centre, Open Label, Non-Randomized, Non Interventional, Observational Study on the Safety and Efficacy of Biphasic Insulin Aspart (NovoMix® 30, NovoMix® 50 and NovoMix® 70 or Combinations) in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This study is conducted in Asia. The aim of this observational study is to evaluate the safety profile and clinical effectiveness of using various pre-mixes of Biphasic Insulin Aspart under routine clinical practice conditions in Israel in Type 2 Diabetes patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of all major hypoglycaemic (daytime and nocturnal) episodes
Number of all minor and symptomatic (daytime and nocturnal) hypoglycaemic episodes
Number of major hypoglycaemic episodes related to omission of a meal after injection
Number of major hypoglycaemic episodes related to physical exercise of at least 30 min duration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the study after 13 weeks of treatment
at the end of the study after 13 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients reaching the target of HbA1c of 7.0% or less
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the study after 13 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Variability in fasting blood glucose values and average (mean) fasting blood glucose level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the study after 13 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Average post-breakfast (2h), post-lunch (2h), post-dinner (2h) blood glucose level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the study after 13 weeks of treatment

intervention.description: Dose and frequency to be prescribed by the physician as a result of the normal clinical evaluation
Dose and frequency to be prescribed by the physician as a result of the normal clinical evaluation
Dose and frequency to be prescribed by the physician as a result of the normal clinical evaluation

study_pop.textblock: Any patient with type 2 diabetes who has HbA1c greater than 7% on insulin with or without OAD and who needs intensification of treatment with either NovoMix® 30, NovoMix® 50 or NovoMix® 70 or combinations, will be eligible A nonrandomized sample of approximately 325 subjects with Type 2 diabetes mellitus will be enrolled.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any patient with type 2 diabetes who has HbA1c greater than 7% on insulin with or without OAD and who needs intensification of treatment with either NovoMix® 30 or NovoMix® 50 or NovoMix® 70 or combinations, will be eligible
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a hypersensitivity to biphasic insulin aspart or to any of the excipients. Particular attention should be paid to the drug interactions that are listed within the product local label.
- Women who are pregnant, breast feeding or have the intention of becoming pregnant within the next 12 months.

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Insulin degludec, insulin aspart drug combination
Insulin aspart, insulin aspart protamine drug combination 30:70
